questions.question: What are the five core Google Cloud storage products discussed in the course?

options.A: Cloud Storage, Bigtable, Cloud SQL, Spanner, and Firestore
options.B: Google Drive, BigQuery, Cloud SQL, Spanner, and Firebase
options.C: Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud SQL, Spanner, and Firestore
options.D: Google Drive, Bigtable, Cloud SQL, Spanner, and Firebase

questions.question: Which storage service is described as a versatile and scalable object storage service?
For what purposes is Cloud Storage suitable?

options.A: Data backups, media serving, and analytics

questions.question: Which service is a fully managed relational database service supporting MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server?
What type of database is Cloud Spanner?
Which of the following is a managed NoSQL document database?
What is Bigtable primarily used for?
What are the main types of cloud storage covered in the course?

options.A: Object Storage, Block Storage, and File Storage
options.B: Hot Storage, Cold Storage, and Archive Storage
options.C: Primary Storage, Secondary Storage, and Tertiary Storage
options.D: Local Storage, Network Storage, and Cloud Storage

questions.question: Which Google Cloud service represents Object Storage?
What is Block Storage provided by in Google Cloud?
Which service offers managed network file storage (NFS)?
What are the different storage classes offered by Cloud Storage?
Which Cloud Storage class is for frequently accessed data?
For data accessed less than once a month, which storage class is most cost-effective?
Which storage class is designed for data accessed less than once a quarter?
What is the most economical choice for long-term data archiving and disaster recovery?
What does Cloud SQL manage for the user?

options.A: The underlying operating system and database software
options.D: The physical security of the data center

questions.question: What are the benefits of Cloud Spanner?

options.A: Combines the benefits of relational and non-relational databases
options.B: It is the cheapest storage option
options.C: It is only for small-scale applications

questions.question: What kind of data is Firestore designed for?
What is a key feature of Bigtable?

options.B: It is a wide-column NoSQL database
options.C: It is designed for small datasets

questions.question: What is unstructured data?

options.A: Data that does not have a pre-defined data model
options.B: Data that is organized in a specific way
options.C: Data that is stored in a relational database
options.D: Data that is easy to search and analyze

questions.question: What is an example of unstructured data?

options.A: A table in a relational database

questions.question: What is the purpose of Persistent Disks?

options.B: To provide reliable, high-performance block storage for virtual machine instances
options.C: To store and serve web content

questions.question: What is a shared filesystem?

options.A: A filesystem that can be accessed by multiple users or applications at the same time
options.B: A filesystem that is only accessible by a single user
options.C: A filesystem that is stored on a single computer
options.D: A filesystem that is not connected to a network

questions.question: What is the benefit of using different storage classes in Cloud Storage?

options.A: To increase the durability of data
options.B: To optimize costs based on how frequently data is accessed
options.C: To improve the performance of data access

questions.question: What is 'hot' data?

options.C: Data that is archived for long-term storage
options.D: Data that is no longer needed

questions.question: What is the hands-on lab in the course about?

options.B: Creating a Cloud Storage bucket, uploading an image, and configuring a web server to use it

questions.question: Which storage service is a good choice for a mobile application that needs to store user data in a flexible, scalable way?
Which storage service would you use to store large amounts of historical data for analysis?
Which storage service would you use for a traditional relational database that requires strong consistency?
